title: Three arrested with ‘Kush’ cannabis worth over Rs. 40 mln at BIA
byline: A stock of ‘Kush’ cannabis worth Rs. 40 million, which had been brought into the country hidden inside luggage, was seized by officers of the Katunayake Airport Police Narcotics Division, last night (19).

title: Trump signs bill ordering justice department to release Jeffrey Epstein files
byline: US President Donald Trump announced on Wednesday that he has signed a bill ordering the release of all files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Sri Lanka expresses readiness to further deepen cooperation with EU
byline: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Arun Hemachandra has held constructive discussions with Șerban-Dimitrie Sturdza, the Chair of the Delegation for Relations with the Countries of South Asia of the European Parliament, together with members of the Delegation.

title: Budget 2026: Expenditure heads of Energy Ministry to be debated today
byline: The expenditure heads of the Ministry of Energy is scheduled to be debated in Parliament today (20).

title: Showers expected in most provinces after 1pm
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the other areas of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: Gunman in Kotahena shooting arrested with ‘Ice’ in Hasalaka
byline: The gunman in the shooting incident reported in Kotahena on November 7, has been arrested in Kolongoda, Hasalaka, police stated.

title: Myanmar junta says raided online scam centre, arrested over 300
byline: Myanmar’s military said Wednesday (Nov 19) it raided an internet scam hub on the Thai border, arresting nearly 350 people, part of a highly publicised crackdown against the booming black market compounds.

title: Meta to remove under-16 Australians from Facebook, Instagram on Dec 4
byline: Australians younger than 16 will be removed from Facebook and Instagram on Dec 4, tech giant Meta said Thursday (Nov 20), as Canberra prepares to enforce sweeping laws banning teens from social media.

title: President to launch second phase of ‘A Nation United’ campaign in Hambantota today
byline: The Southern Provincial Programme of the ‘A Nation United’ anti-drug campaign is scheduled to be launched in Hambantota today (20).

title: Turkey set to host COP31 as Australia steps aside
byline: The COP31 climate meeting is now expected to be held in Turkey after Australia dropped its bid to host the annual event.

title: Energy Ministry budgetary allocation to be debated today
byline: The expenditure heads of the Ministry of Energy is scheduled to be debated in Parliament today (20).

title: IRD records highest-ever tax revenue in history
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has achieved the highest tax revenue collection in its history this year.

title: Showers expected in most provinces after 1pm today
byline: Several spells of showers are expected in the Northern, North-central provinces and in the Trincomalee district today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Train operations on up-country railway line continue to be disrupted
byline: Train operations on the up-country railway line continue to be disrupted due to the derailment caused by fallen trees and a landslide between Idalgashinna and Ohiya railway stations, Sri Lanka Railways stated.

title: Govt. revises fee levied to issue driving licences to foreign nationals
byline: The government has taken steps to revise the fees levied to issue driving licences to foreign nationals.

title: Smoking among schoolchildren has increased, experts say
byline: Smoking among schoolchildren has increased, Specialist Respiratory Physician Dr. Duminda Yasaratne at the Peradeniya Teaching Hospital stated.

title: Novelist Rabih Alameddine and poet Patricia Smith win National Book Awards
byline: Rabih Alameddine’s blend of family comedy and wartime tragedy, “The True True Story of Raja the Gullible (and His Mother),” has won the National Book Award for fiction.

title: SLFP suspends members who supported NPP to pass 2026 budgets at LG bodies
byline: The party membership of eight Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) local government councilors have been temporarily suspended.

title: Police constable arrested over drug trafficking
byline: A police constable attached to the Panadura Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau has been arrested over alleged involvement in drug trafficking.

title: Foreigners to face legal action for driving three-wheelers without valid license in Sri Lanka
byline: Instructions have been issued to all police stations to initiate legal actions against foreign nationals found driving three-wheelers without a valid driving license, the Police Headquarters stated.

title: South Korean ferry runs aground, all 267 people on board rescued
byline: All 267 people on board a South Korean passenger ferry that ran aground off the southwestern tip of the Korean peninsula on Wednesday were rescued, in an incident that revived memories of the major ferry disaster in 2014 in which 300 people died.

title: Date set to hear petitions filed against decision to outsource e-visas by previous govt.
byline: The Supreme Court today ordered that the fundamental rights petitions filed seeking an order to nullify the previous government’s decision to hand over the issuance of electronic visas to private companies, be taken up again on February 9, 2026.

title: Attention drawn towards accurately surveying and mapping of all land plots in Sri Lanka
byline: Attention has been drawn towards the importance of accurately surveying and swiftly completing the mapping of all land plots in Sri Lanka during a meeting of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Environment, Agriculture and Resource Sustainability in Parliament.

title: NPP held Yatiyanthota PS maiden budget defeated
byline: The 2026 budget of the Yatiyanthota Pradeshiya Sabha, which is controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated by a margin of four votes.

title: US–Sri Lanka defense agreement tabled in Parliament for the second time
byline: The defence agreement signed between Sri Lanka and the United States will be tabled in Parliament for the second time today (20), the Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd) stated.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 6 strikes Seram, Indonesia, GFZ reports
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6 struck Seram, Indonesia, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said on Thursday.

title: FM invites Indian filmmakers to explore opportunities in Sri Lanka
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath invited Indian investors and filmmakers to consider Sri Lanka as a prime destination for film production, events, and hospitality ventures.

title: Trump says he will meet Zohran Mamdani at White House on Friday
byline: US President Donald Trump said he will meet New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday (Nov 21) in what would be the first meeting of the Republican leader with the democratic socialist who won this month’s mayoral election.

title: 25-30% transgender sex workers in Sri Lanka addicted to drugs, new survey reveals
byline: A recent survey has revealed that between 25% and 30% of transgender sex workers in the country are addicted to drugs.

title: Another vessel suspected to be carrying narcotics seized in southern seas
byline: Another fishing vessel carrying six Sri Lankan fishermen has been taken into custody on suspicion of transporting drugs, police stated.

title: Meta’s chief AI scientist Yann LeCun to leave Meta and start new AI research company
byline: Artificial intelligence pioneer Yann LeCun said Wednesday he will be leaving his job as Meta’s chief AI scientist at the end of the year.

title: ‘A Nation United’: Southern Province program of anti-drug campaign launched in Tangalle
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has arrived for the launch ceremony of the Southern Provincial Programme of the “A Nation United” National Mission to defeat the drug menace, which commence in Tangalle a short while ago.

title: 30kg of Kush seized at Central Mail Exchange
byline: Thirty kilograms of Kush cannabis, estimated to be worth around Rs. 150 million, have been discovered at the Central Mail Exchange in Colombo.

title: Special traffic plan in Nugegeoda due to public rally tomorrow
byline: Sri Lanka Police announced that vehicular movement will be restricted due to a public rally scheduled to be held on Friday (November 21) at the Ananda Samarakoon Open Air Theatre, within the Mirihana Police Division.

title: NPP-held Tangalle UC budget defeated, Weligama PS budget passed
byline: The maiden budget of the Tangalle Urban Council, which is under the control of the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated.

title: 25 cybercrime complaints reported daily, says Public Security Minister
byline: Approximately 25 complaints related to cybercrimes are reported daily, according to the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs.

title: US naval experts in Sri Lanka to help broaden hydrographic mapping skills
byline: A team of experts attached to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration of the US Department of Commerce and the Naval Meteorology and Oceanography Command has arrived in Sri Lanka to help expand the country’s hydrographic mapping skills.

title: No driving licences will be issued to foreigners to drive three-wheelers – DMT confirms
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has announced that it will not issue driving licences to foreign nationals to drive three-wheelers for the time being. MORE.

title: China says trade cooperation with Japan ‘severely damaged’ by Taiwan comments
byline: Trade cooperation between China and Japan has been “severely damaged”, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday, urging the Japanese prime minister to retract her comments on Taiwan or face the consequences.

title: Louvre museum to add 100 external cameras by 2026 after heist exposed security flaws
byline: France’s Louvre Museum will install 100 external cameras by the end of 2026 as part of measures to tighten security after last month’s spectacular heist, its director said on Wednesday.

title: Roblox steps up age checks and groups younger users into age-based chats
byline: Roblox is stepping up its age verification system for users who want to chat with other players and implementing age-based chats so kids, teens and adults will only be able to communicate with people around their own age.

title: The Guangwushan Model: How Sri Lanka Can Turn Geo-Heritage Into Global Tourism Gold
byline: Op-Ed: The Wonders of Guangwushan-Nuoshuihe UNESCO Global Geopark: A Lesson for Sri Lanka’s Tourism.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai defends H1-B visa programme: ‘Contributions of immigrants has been phenomenal’
byline: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai has voiced his support for the H1-B visa programme while hailing the contribution of immigrants to the tech industry.

title: 5,000 Sri Lankans to be trained for employment opportunities in Japan next year
byline: Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) Chairman, Kosala Wickramasinghe, stated that the bureau aims to establish a pool of 5,000 Sri Lankans who have completed Japanese language training within 2026.

title: Colombo-Badulla night mail trains cancelled for second day
byline: The two night mail trains operating between Colombo and Badulla will be cancelled today (20) as well, due to an obstruction of the railway line between Ohiya and Idalgashinna.

title: President claims certain groups attempting to create artificial issues to cover up real issues
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says his goal is to prevent children from becoming victims of the drug menace, and that a government has now been formed that will not provide political protection to any criminal.

title: Death toll reaches 33 in some of the deadliest Israeli strikes in Gaza since the ceasefire’s start
byline: A pair of Israeli strikes in Gaza’s southern city of Khan Younis early Thursday killed five people, hospital officials said, bringing the death toll from airstrikes in the Palestinian territory over a roughly 12-hour period to 33. The strikes have been some of the deadliest since Oct. 10 when a U.S.-brokered ceasefire took effect.

title: Fishing vessel carrying heroin, ‘Ice’ and firearms brought to Tangalle Harbour
byline: The multi-day fishing vessel suspected of carrying narcotics, which was intercepted today (20), by the Sri Lanka Navy in the southern seas has been brought to the Tangalle Fisheries Harbour along with the six local fishermen arrested while on board.

title: Sri Lanka, India hold bilateral talks on sidelines of NSA-Level Meeting of Colombo Security Conclave
byline: Sri Lanka and India held a bilateral discussion on the sidelines of the 7th National Security Advisers-level Meeting of the Colombo Security Conclave (CSC), held in New Delhi from 19 to 20 November 2025.
